page.name: Strength
page.content:
Strength

Strength measures bodily power, athletic training, and raw physical power.

Ability Checks
Use general ability checks for situations like:

  • An attempt to lift a very heavy object.
  • Trying to push open a stuck door.
  • Attempting to break free from bonds.
  • Carrying something a long way.
  • Trying to hold on to a ledge or rope.

Attack & Damage Rolls
The Strength modifier is added to attack and damage rolls for:

  • Melee Attacks
  • Ranged Attacks with Thrown Weapons

Alternate Skills
Some skills you can pair with this ability are:

  • Animal Handling. Attempting to use brute force to subdue an animal.
  • Intimidation. Trying to look scary versus trying to threaten someone with words.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 175

page.name: Athletics
page.content:
Athletics

General athletic prowess when running, jumping, swimming, and climbing.

Skill Checks
Use athletics skill checks for situations like:

  • Attemping to climb a cliff or rope.
  • Trying to jump very high or far.
  • Swimming against a strong current.

Alternate Abilities
Abilities that can be paired with this skill are:

  • Constitution. Running long distance are as much about constitution as strength.
  • Dexterity. Some feats are more about dexterity, but see Acrobatics first.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 175

page.name: Dexterity
page.content:
Dexterity

Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, and balance.

Ability Checks
Use general ability checks for situations like:

  • Picking a lock or disabling a trap.
  • Tie up a prisoner with some rope.
  • Wriggle free after being tied up.
  • Craft a small or detailed object.

Initiative is a general dexterity check.

Attack & Damage Rolls
The Dexterity modifier is added to attack and damage rolls for:

  • Ranged Attacks
  • Melee Attacks with Finesse Weapons

Alternate Skills
Some skills you can pair with this ability are:

  • Athletics. Some feats of athleticism might be better suited to dexterity than strength.
  • Performance. Playing an instrument may be a better ability to use than charisma.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 176

page.name: Acrobatics
page.content:
Acrobatics

Acrobatics measures the ability to maintain balance, tumble, and perform tricks in the air.

Skill Checks
Use skill checks for situations like:

  • Walk across a tightrope.
  • Maintain balance on a rocking ship.
  • Parkour down a cluttered alley.

Alternate Abilities
Abilities that can be paired with this skill are:

  • N/A

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 176

page.name: Armor Class
page.content:
Armor Class

A creature’s natural armor class is how hard they are to hit when not wearing armor.

Natural AC = 10 + Dexterity Modifier

Wearing Armor
Wearing armor replaces a creature’s natural AC with that of the armor they are wearing.

Armor Type AC
Padded L 11 + DEX
Leather L 11 + DEX
Studded L 12 + DEX
Hide M 12 + DEX (max 2)
Chain Shirt M 13 + DEX (max 2)
Scale Mail M 14 + DEX (max 2)
Breastplate M 14 + DEX (max 2)
Half Plate M 15 + DEX (max 2)

Characters wearing heavy armor do not add their DEX modifier to their AC.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 145, 177

page.name: Hiding
page.content:
Hiding

Contest between hider & active searcher.

Hider (Stealth) v. Searcher (Perception)

  • DM decides when hiding is possible.
  • Cannot hide if clearly visible.
  • Cannot hide if searcher saw you hide.
  • Invisible creatures can always try.
  • Sound & tracks can give them away.
  • Ends if discovered or stop hiding.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 177

page.name: Ability Modifiers
page.content:
Ability Modifiers

Score +/- Score +/-
1 -5 16-17 +3
2-3 -4 18-19 +4
4-5 -3 20-21 +5
6-7 -2 22-23 +6
8-9 -1 24-25 +7
10-11 0 26-27 +8
12-13 +1 28-29 +9
14-15 +2 30 +10

Rules

  • The average for commoners is 10-11.
  • The character ability maximum is 20.
  • The monster ability maximum is 30.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 13, 173

page.name: Advantage
page.content:
Advantage
Advantage Roll 2d20 and take the higher of the two rolls.
Disdvantage Roll 2d20 and take the lower of the two rolls.

Rules

  • A player cannot have double advantage or disadvantage. They do not stack.
  • A player with advantage & disadvantage gets neither. It is straight roll.
  • A feat or feature that allows a player to roll again, they choose which die.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 173

page.name: Contests
page.content:
Contests

Contest Attacker Defender
Hide Stealth Perception
Grapple Athletics Athletics / Acrobatics
Shove Athletics Athletics / Acrobatics
Untie Knot Sleight of Hand Sleight of Hand
Disarm Attack Athletics / Acrobatics

Rules

  • Both PCs roll a d20 and add modifiers.
  • The higher check wins the contest.
  • In the event of a tie, the initiator loses.

Sources: Player’s Handbook, p. 174
